memberdef.definition: typedef UA_StatusCode(* UA_NodeIteratorCallback)(UA_NodeId childId, UA_Boolean isInverse, UA_NodeId referenceTypeId, void *handle)
memberdef.argsstring: )(UA_NodeId childId, UA_Boolean isInverse, UA_NodeId referenceTypeId, void *handle)
memberdef.name: UA_NodeIteratorCallback

detaileddescription.para: Sets the logger used by the server
Runs the main loop of the server. In each iteration, this calls into the networklayers to see if jobs have arrived and checks if repeated jobs need to be triggered.

parameterdescription.para: The server object
The number of worker threads. Is ignored if MULTITHREADING is not activated.
Points to a boolean value on the heap. When running is set to false, the worker threads and the main loop close and the server is shut down.

simplesect.para: Indicates whether the server shut down cleanly

briefdescription.para: Add a new namespace to the server. Returns the index of the new namespace.

memberdef.argsstring: (UA_Server *server, const UA_NodeId sourceId, const UA_NodeId refTypeId, const UA_ExpandedNodeId targetId)
memberdef.name: UA_Server_addReference

detaileddescription.para: Add a reference to the server's address space
Deletes a node from the nodestore.

parameterdescription.para: The server object
ID of the node to be deleted

simplesect.para: Return UA_STATUSCODE_GOOD if the node was deleted or an appropriate errorcode if the node was not found or cannot be deleted.

detaileddescription.para: Deletes a copied instance of a node by deallocating it and all its attributes. This assumes that the node was priorly copied using getNodeCopy. To delete nodes that are located in the nodestore, use UA_Server_deleteNode() instead.

parameterdescription.para: The server object
A copy of any node-type struct created with getNodeCopy; must *not* be managed by the nodestore.

simplesect.para: Return UA_STATUSCODE_GOOD if the node was deleted or an appropriate errorcode if the node was not found or cannot be deleted.

detaileddescription.para: Creates a deep copy of a node located in the nodestore and returns it to the userspace. Note that any manipulation of this copied node is not reflected by the server, but otherwise not accessible attributes of the node's struct can be examined in bulk. node->nodeClass can be used to cast the node to a specific node type. Use UA_Server_deleteNodeCopy() to deallocate this node.

parameterdescription.para: The server object
ID of the node copy to be copied
Pointer to a NULL pointer that will hold the copy of the node on a successfull return.

simplesect.para: Return UA_STATUSCODE_GOOD if the node was copied or an appropriate errorcode if the node was not found or cannot be copied.

memberdef.argsstring: (UA_Server *server, UA_NodeId nodeId, const UA_QualifiedName browseName, UA_LocalizedText displayName, UA_LocalizedText description, const UA_NodeId parentNodeId, const UA_NodeId referenceTypeId, UA_UInt32 userWriteMask, UA_UInt32 writeMask, UA_Variant *value, UA_NodeId *createdNodeId)
memberdef.name: UA_Server_addVariableNode

detaileddescription.para: A new variable Node with a value passed in variant.

parameterdescription.para: The server object
The requested nodeId of the new node. Use the numeric id with i=0 to get a new ID from the server.
The qualified name of this node
The localized text shown when displaying the node
The localized human readable description
The node under which this node exists ("parent")
Reference type used by the parent to reference this node
Bitmask defining the user write permissions
Bitmask defining the write permissions
A variant containing the value to be assigned to this node.
Pointer to a NULL pointer that will hold the copy of the nodeId on a successfull return.

simplesect.para: Return UA_STATUSCODE_GOOD if the node was created or an appropriate error code if not.

memberdef.name: UA_Server_addMonodirectionalReference

detaileddescription.para: Iterate over all nodes referenced by parentNodeId by calling the callback function for each child node

parameterdescription.para: The server object.
The NodeId of the parent whose references are to be iterated over
The function of type UA_NodeIteratorCallback to be called for each referenced child

simplesect.para: Upon success, UA_STATUSCODE_GOOD is returned. An error code otherwise.

parameterdescription.para: The server object.
Pointer to the job that shall be added. The pointer is not freed but copied to an internal representation.
The job shall be repeatedly executed with the given interval (in ms). The interval must be larger than 5ms. The first execution occurs at now() + interval at the latest.
Set to the guid of the repeated job. This can be used to cancel the job later on. If the pointer is null, the guid is not set.

simplesect.para: Upon success, UA_STATUSCODE_GOOD is returned. An error code otherwise.

detaileddescription.para: Remove repeated job. The entry will be removed asynchronously during the next iteration of the server main loop.

parameterdescription.para: The server object.
The id of the job that shall be removed.

simplesect.para: Upon sucess, UA_STATUSCODE_GOOD is returned. An error code otherwise.

detaileddescription.para: Adds a network layer to the server. The network layer is destroyed together with the server. Do not use it after adding it as it might be moved around on the heap.
